comment.text: Enzyme activity is regulated by acetylation.
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-arginine biosynthesis; L-arginine from L-ornithine and carbamoyl phosphate: step 3/3.
Nitrogen metabolism; urea cycle; L-arginine and fumarate from (N(omega)-L-arginino)succinate: step 1/1.

isoform.text: Gene prediction based on EST data.
Gene prediction based on EST data.

comment.text: Acetylation modifies enzyme activity in response to alterations of extracellular nutrient availability. Acetylation increased with trichostin A (TSA) or with nicotinamide (NAM). Glucose increases acetylation by about a factor of 3 with decreasing enzyme activity. Acetylation on Lys-288 is decreased on the addition of extra amino acids resulting in activation of enzyme activity.

disease.name: Argininosuccinic aciduria
disease.description: An autosomal recessive disorder of the urea cycle. The disease is characterized by mental and physical retardation, liver enlargement, skin lesions, dry and brittle hair showing trichorrhexis nodosa microscopically and fluorescing red, convulsions, and episodic unconsciousness.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the lyase 1 family. Argininosuccinate lyase subfamily.
